title: Sean Fitzharris
text:
Sean Fitzharris (born 13 October 1991, in <a href="Greenock">Greenock</a>) is a Scottish <a href="association%20football">football</a> player, who plays for <a href="East%20Kilbride%20F.C.">East Kilbride</a> in the <a href="Lowland%20Football%20League">Lowland Football League</a>. Fitzharris came through the youth academies of both halves of the <a href="Old%20Firm">Old Firm</a>, <a href="Rangers%20F.C.">Rangers</a> and <a href="Celtic%20F.C.">Celtic</a>.
Club career.
Rangers.
Fitzharris started his youth career at Rangers and played for their under-13, under-14 and under-15 teams before moving to Celtic, where he played for their under-17 and under-19 age groups.
Celtic.
Fitzharris started his career with Celtic, before signing for <a href="Greenock%20Morton%20F.C.">Greenock Morton</a> on loan after scoring a double against them in a training game at the <a href="Lennoxtown%20training%20centre">Lennoxtown training centre</a>.
Fitzharris has featured in Celtic's first team, taking part as a substitute in a friendly victory over <a href="Chris%20Sutton">Chris Sutton</a>'s <a href="Lincoln%20City%20F.C.">Lincoln City</a> to help lift the John Reames Memorial Trophy. Fitzharris was a member of the under-19s League and Cup double winning team in season <a href="2009%E2%80%9310%20in%20Scottish%20football">2009–10</a> scoring the winning goal in the cup final against Rangers at <a href="Hampden%20Park">Hampden Park</a>. He was released at the end of the <a href="2010%E2%80%9311%20in%20Scottish%20football">2010–11 season</a>.
Morton.
Fitzharris signed on loan on 10 September 2010, going straight into the starting line-up the following day in a home defeat against <a href="Cowdenbeath%20F.C.">Cowdenbeath</a>. After returning to Celtic at the end of 2010, Fitzharris was signed on a new loan deal on 7 January 2011 until the end of the season. After his release from Celtic, Fitzharris returned to <a href="Cappielow">Cappielow</a> to sign a one-year contract with Morton. He was released by Morton in January 2012.
Clyde.
After a long spell without a club, Fitzharris signed for <a href="Clyde%20F.C.">Clyde</a> in August 2012 on a one-year deal. Fitzharris went on to agree a contract extension with Clyde at the beginning of May 2013 for a further one year. It was announced on 29 October 2013 that Fitzharris had agreed to a short-term loan deal with non-league side East Kilbride until the end of December 2013. On 12 January 2014, Fitzharris left Clyde and signed for East Kilbride on a permanent deal.
International career.
Fitzharris was a regular in <a href="Ross%20Mathie">Ross Mathie</a>'s <a href="Scotland%20national%20under-17%20football%20team">Scotland U17</a> squad, scoring three goals in seven appearances.
Personal life.
Fitzharris was raised in <a href="Inverkip">Inverkip</a> and attended <a href="St%20Columba%27s%20High%20School%2C%20Gourock">St Columba's High School</a> in <a href="Gourock">Gourock</a>.
